grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 世界恐慌【セカイキョウコウ】worldwide financial crisis, global depression
世界大恐慌【セカイダイキョウコウ】the Great Depression
kun reading compounds: 慌てる【あわてる】to become confused (disconcerted, disorganized, disorganised), to be flustered, to panic, to be in a hurry, to rush
慌てる乞食はもらいが少ない【あわてるこじきはもらいがすくない】slow and steady wins the race, there is luck in the last helping
慌ただしい【あわただしい】busy, hurried, confused, flurried
